subject: using junit with jcovergae !!
msgSnippet: Greetings, I am having a problem generating reports using jcoverge with junit in Eclipse. I am able to instrument the classes, invoke junit & I see that the
messageBody:
Greetings,

I am having a problem generating reports using jcoverge with junit in
Eclipse.
I am able to instrument the classes, invoke junit & I see that the junit
tests are successfully run on the console. I am also pretty sure that the
junit tests are run on the instrumented classes. But the report coverage
shows 0% for both branch and statement.
But, if I use jtestrun, which come along with jcoverage plus, then jcoverage
reports correctly.
Can someone tellme where the problem lies ??

Thanks,

--
/Suchindra
